subject: JUnit 4.1, running tests from and 1.6

messageBody:
I have seen people skating around this issue but nobody seems to be
answering the question or maybe I just missed it - I did search the
archives and I see the question but no answer.

I followed the details in the "JUnit 4.0 in 10 minutes" article. I
wrote a test class. I am using a suite such as

public static junit.framework.Test suite() {
return new JUnit4TestAdapter(TestSynonymEngine.class);
}

I am running my tests from an Ant 1.6.2. In my ant script I have a
target with a <junit> task that ultimately uses a <batchtest> to run
my tests. The tests run and pass or fail appropriately, but, where I
should have the name of the tests that were run I instead get

[junit] Testcase: unknown took 2.109 sec

[junit] Testcase: unknown took 0.156 sec

[junit] Testcase: unknown took 0.11 sec

[junit] Testcase: unknown took 0.204 sec

[junit] Testcase: unknown took 0.093 sec


and my <junitreport> output similarly shows the names of the tests as
"unknown".

It was my understanding that the whole purpose of the
JUnit4TestAdapter was "so that the new JUnit 4 tests can be run with
the old runners". So am I seeing a bug in JUnit4TestAdapter or what?
Did I miss some configuration option or documentation detail or FAQ?
If so, please point me in the right direction.

I would like to move to JUnit4 as I really like the enhancements but
not knowing the name of the failing test is a deal breaker and I don't
have any interest in using alpha-Ant code on my production builds. The
output of <junitreport> is critical for our build process, so...

Kevin
